Landed in Manchester for @BCSCretailprop ... @LocalDataCo will be on stand 122, come and say hello if you are around
@Kelby_McNally we've got each other! #togetherforever - 4 years and going strong! Thats c. £58,000 in rent between us!
8 hour delay returning from Rome, no time to re-pack before Bham, now onto Manc for BCSC, result; no suitable attire for the English Autumn!
RT @MHallett1: Kingfisher set to open another 200 Screwfix stores http://t.co/8UUFpA6Ofo via @ReutersUK #retail
My 5pm flight from Rome "could" now be 1am, who knows. Not even EasyJet knows. Just going to sit here and cry!! Mama Mia!!!
Went to visit the Pope and couldn't get into the Basilica because my… https://t.co/ixnjIkwyja
Photo of a photo, tourist time in #Roma https://t.co/19YwYXguvr
Now time to change hotels, relax and see a bit of Rome... If I can get my case closed... Eek! http://t.co/ub99l3tCsI
Big thanks to @UKTIRetail for supporting @LocalDataCo & I with an invite to @WorldRetail met amazing people, learnt lots..team #GREATBritain
PM session with @birchbox looking at disruptive online businesses who have since opened stores, showing offline is still so key #WRC2015
RT @UKTIRetail: Snapshot of the UKTI delegation at #WRC2015 ! @mrjamiepowell @the_brc @i2iEventsGroup @Allegro_Group @JacquesVert http://t.…
Sir Tim Berners Lee & panel say the future isn't online, it's not stores it's both working together, being interchangeable #futureofretail
RT @UKTIRetail: 'Brand #Britain arguably has a bigger opportunity than any other country. Demand is global.' @martinnewman on the @UKTI pan…
RT @WorldRetail: 92.5% of retail sales occur offline, vs. 7% online notes Jim Manzi, @MasterCardNews @APTtestandlearn. #WRC2015 #futureofr…
RT @WorldRetail: "The new business model is simple in the front, sophisticated at the back" - JC, @LEVIS. #WRC2015 http://t.co/KjwsdO72Y8
RT @IanMcGarrigle1: We started in online food 18 years ago but the real momentum has come in the last 5 years says Asda's Andy Clarke #futu…
Andy Clark: online still sub 10% of the business. Key is efficiency in the portfolio, transforming formats to suit new use of space #WRC2015
Levi's JC on making the brand a "150 year old start up" & giving "fans" what they want but also what they don't know they want yet #WRC2015
Day 2 begins with a Bob Dylan song from the president of Levi's.. What a start! Today focusses on retail transformation #WRC2015
Proud to be a part of the @UKTIRetail delegation at #WRC2015 ... https://t.co/26nVI1UdMd
Fab end to the day with @UKTIRetail VIP drinks reception. Exhausted but learning so much also, same again tomorrow!
Key themes today, innovation & disruption though, data from PlanetRetail: no.1 reason for choosing a retailer; conveniently located #WRC2015
Great presentation from @UKTIRetail this morning at #WRC2015 http://t.co/3DDE9txG0Q
Sir Ian Cheshire leads PM panel, comment "stores are the new black", stores key in omnichannel but they must be more experiential #WRC2015
AM session w/ @UKTIRetail - Now 962 SC's in Italy, rise of discounter & convenience in food & multiples dominate. Sound familiar? #WRC2015
Just arrived at the Rome Cavalieri for #WRC2015 - beautiful venue! Looking forward to an interesting day
RT @UKTIRetail: UKTI's retail team are en route to Rome for #WRC2015 - who else will be there? We hope to meet you at our stand and in the …
RT @retailweek: Primark sales to jump 13% on back of aggressive store expansion http://t.co/z2PTbIEjAk (£)
Great to catch up with the wonderful @retailTRUST committee last night. London Celebration 2016 coming along nicely!
.@LocalDataCo Retail Summit done & dusted, next stop Rome w/ @UKTIRetail for @WorldRetail Looking forward to being part of the UKTI mission!
RT @simondevonshire: Staggering 31.2% of UK empty shops have been vacant for more than THREE YEARS. Amazing insight from @LocalDataCo #LDCI…
Jackie Sadek, advisor to Secretary of State, discusses alternative uses for the high street; health, education, community #LDCInsights
Alan Giles of @OxfordSBS - there is still a mismatch between supply & demand with an ever changing / mobile consumer #LDCInsights
.@BBCEmmaSimpson on her experiences of Kettering & others. "No one solution for all high streets", each HS has it's own issues #LDCInsights
.@MalcolmMoore now leading our brilliant panel, interesting commentary to come no doubt #LdcInsights
Across all locations types, roughly a 3rd of vacancies are "persistent" 3+ years #LdcInsights
Vacancy rates in shopping centres also v diverse by region, London consistently low but does operate in a bubble as we know #LDCInsights
Retail park vacancy rates for the East Midlands is lowest of all regions. Proud Notts girl! Rates for North West almost double #LDCInsights
RT @simondevonshire: Full house for @LocalDataCo 12th Retail Summit #LDCInsights http://t.co/nAH6cqphAD
RT @bwoswald: "Quality of life isn't about what you find in shops; it's about the landscape" #LDCInsights
Top 10 towns with highest vacancy rates mainly in the West Midlands and North West. Still a clear north / south divide #LDCInsights
Retail park vacancy rate 6.6% v SCs at 14.8% - brands flocking to parks as they evolve w/ smaller units & leisure / retail mix #LDCInsights
Up bright and early for @LocalDataCo Retail Summit #ldcinsights http://t.co/oW3k9hQRUX
Looking forward to @LocalDataCo breakfast briefing on vacancy rates tomorrow AM. https://t.co/ljCe5w79J5

RT @GeorgeMacD: Jack Wills founder Peter Williams is to become CEO again. Wendy Becker is leaving. Full story on @retailweek shortly.
Didnt watch #spendingsecrets last night? Catch up! When I grow up I want to be Anne Robinson! & premise of the programme is fascinating..

RT @bira_says: Every region of GB lost shops, net, in H1, with the welcome exception of North East, which gained, overall, 12 shops. London…
RT @bira_says: Independent shops increased in East of England, NE, NW, Wales, Yorkshire. London lost 175 in H1. Overall 144 down.
.@SFenwickReports leads our panel session following @MattheHopkinson presentation - time for questions #LDCinsights
RT @HLRealEstate: Data suggests net growth/openings in North East and Wales. The NW Northern Powerhouse is still adjusting to an oversupply…
RT @HLRealEstate: The Telegraph picks up on #LDCinsights https://t.co/WAt8CMnzFX
We cannot look at any of these changes as being global, very much seeing regional differences in all trends #LDCInsights
Retail parks, only location type seeing a positive change w/ 225 openings. Smaller parades in contrast shown to be struggling #LDCInsights
Yorkshire & Humber seeing the lowest rate of churn across all regions at 8.2% #LDCInsights
More closures than openings across Greater London, however Wales seeing positive churn with a small % more openings #LDCInsights
Who are the fastest fallers? Interesting to see women's clothing high on that list #LDCInsights
Lifestyle and changing lifestyle choices evident in the Openings & Closures data, convenience increasing, health & beauty also #LDCinsights
In the fashion space we're seeing nearly 16% churn versus 9.9% being the GB average #LDCinsights
